question: i am a 57 yr old female having palpations, shortness of breath, heaviness in chest, extreme tiredness, & dropping in blood pressure.  i have had a chest x-ray (showed thickening in lung walls), abnormal ekg (showed pac's & pvc's), abnormal stress test (showed 2 slightly leaking ventrical valves), normal echo, & normal heart cath.  still having symptoms.  i have diabetes 2 (take actos), hypothyroidism ( take synthroid), and am post-tongue cancer (approx 6 yrs).  no high blood pressure.  never smoked.  do not drink.  is it possible i can have cmd (microvascular coronary dysfunction?)  if so, how can it be corrected?  any other possible diagnosis?  thank you for your time & assistance.
title: palpations, sob, chest pain, tiredness
